Unfortunately, I cannot view or insert images. However, I can help you find the minimum number of triangles required to dissect a square with a side length of 5 cm.

To dissect a square into triangles, you can draw a diagonal from one corner to the opposite corner. This will create two right-angled triangles. This is the minimum number of triangles required to dissect a square, as you cannot create a triangle with fewer than three sides.

So, the minimum number of triangles required to dissect a square with a side length of 5 cm is 2.
